title: Miscellaneous Projects
text:
This page contains a collection of miscellaneous projects (that may or may not be related to my research), mostly involving  programming.




(WORK IN PROGRESS‚Ä¶)
Project website | Code
This website collects the materials for a four day workshop organized by MITGEST Doctoral Network in July 2024. The workshop is offered as part of a summer School for EU doctoral students in life sciences, hosted by the Radboud Center for Mitochondrial Medicine, in Nijmegen, Netherlands. My sister designed the workshop and its lectures, and I contributed to it by preparing the 4 R practice sessions, and by building the dedicated website.




Project website | Code | (in Italian üáÆüáπ)
This is website created to disseminate a position paper prepared by a working group on behalf of the Catholic Church o my city (Pavia). The report offers proposals for discussion in view of the upcoming municipal elections of June 2024.




(WORK IN PROGRESS‚Ä¶)
Project website | Code
This is an ongoing project I started to explore text analytics to answer a question that I find extremely interesting and compelling: What is the impact of slogans on policy decisions? My working hypothesis is that often slogans involves a progressive detachment of words/phrases from their original meaning, so ‚ÄúWhy‚Äù and ‚Äúhow‚Äù does such a deviation between words and reality occur? 












Project website | Code
This is a quick exploration of some EU structural funds aimed at verifying how much we have been able to disburse (given amounts planned and deemed eligible) for the 2014-2020 funding cycle. Specifically data are taken from the ESIF 2014-2020 Finance Implementation Details (99js-gm52) dataset, then I drill down to programs under the ERDF (European Regional Development Fund).




Here is a tutorial I wrote as I was learning how to implement cluster analysis in R.
HTML page |

title: Luisa Maria Mimmi
text:
üëãüèª Hi there! üëãüèª
I am Luisa, a Policy & Data Analyst, freelance consultant, and  enthusiast.
My professional focus lies at the intersection of Economics, Public Policy and Data Science. In over 20 years of experience (in Italy and in the US), I have worked on the entire analytic cycle (data collection-analysis-presentation) for several research projects applied to the field of economic development and the evaluation of public economic policies.
You can learn more about my background and academic publications via the links below, or on my CV. 

As a freelance consultant, I currently support institutional clients (like the Italian Government), academic researchers and individual professionals in their statistics and data analysis endeavors. With my contribution I bring an analytical foundation to projects, and help making data-driven decision regardless of the sector, core business or size of the organization. I have also successfully delivered talks and workshops on statistics and reproducible quantitative research.

This website showcases some of my recent projects, mostly involving R programming for data analysis and/or the creation of static websites for data and/or technical content dissemination (in English üá∫üá∏ and Italian üáÆüáπ).

Feel free to reach out if you think I can collaborate with you or your team with any statistics, data analysis, or R projects.
